A fig-tree. From sukon; a fig-tree.

13.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
13.str2: To shake; fig: I agitate, stir up. Apparently a primary verb; to rock, i.e. to agitate; figuratively, to throw into a tremor.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Large, great, in the widest sense.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.

14.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

14.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
14.str2: To separate from; mid: I part; pass: To be swept aside. From apo and chorizo; to rend apart; reflexively, to separate.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.

14.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
14.str2: To roll, roll up, fold up. A form of heilisso; to coil or wrap.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
An island. Probably from the base of naus; an island.

14.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
14.str2: To set in motion, move, remove, excite, stir up. From kio; to stir, literally or figuratively.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

14.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Plural
14.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.

15.str2: And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A great one, a lord; a courtier, satrap, nobleman. Plural from megistos; grandees.

A commander of a thousand men, a military tribune. From chilioi and archo; the commander of a thousand soldiers
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure. From ischus; forcible.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
And, even, also, namely.
Free, delivered from obligation. Probably from the alternate of erchomai; unrestrained, i.e. not a slave, or exempt.

15.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
15.str2: To hide, conceal, lay up. A primary verb; to conceal.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A cave, den, hideout. Neuter of a presumed derivative of speos; a cavern; by implication, a hiding-place or resort.
And, even, also, namely.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

16.str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
16.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
16.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.

16.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular

17.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
17.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

17.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
17.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
